cards.content: Develop and maintain MUSE platform with core features: logic model builder, evidence library, impact metrics framework, and GitHub integration for Ethereum ecosystem use cases
Engage Ethereum community through documentation, tutorials, conference presentations (Devcon, ETHGlobal), and partnerships with key ecosystem organizations (EF, Gitcoin, Optimism)
Create Ethereum-specific templates and case studies: grant program evaluation, protocol upgrade impact assessment, DAO governance decision frameworks, and public goods funding models
Active user base of 500+ Ethereum ecosystem stakeholders (DAO members, grant managers, core devs) using MUSE for decision-making and impact assessment
1,000+ logic models created for Ethereum projects covering grants evaluation, protocol improvements, ecosystem development, and public goods funding decisions
50+ GitHub stars, 20+ contributors, and integration with major Ethereum tools (Gitcoin Grants, Snapshot, Charmverse) demonstrating ecosystem adoption
Ethereum grant programs (Gitcoin, Optimism RPGF, Arbitrum) adopt MUSE for structured evaluation, leading to 30% more evidence-based funding decisions within 6 months
DAOs using MUSE report 40% reduction in governance proposal revision cycles due to clearer impact frameworks and stakeholder alignment
Ethereum ecosystem develops culture of impact measurement with 100+ projects publicly sharing logic models and impact data, increasing transparency and accountability (12-18 months)
Improved capital allocation efficiency: $50M+ in Ethereum grants and DAO treasuries allocated using MUSE frameworks, with measurable impact tracking and retrospective analysis
MUSE becomes standard tool referenced in Ethereum governance discussions, with integration into major DAO platforms and grant program workflows
Ethereum ecosystem achieves 25% improvement in public goods funding effectiveness, with better alignment between funded projects and ecosystem needs (18-36 months)
MUSE methodology adopted beyond Ethereum to other blockchain ecosystems (Cosmos, Polkadot, Solana), establishing cross-chain standards for impact measurement
Ethereum ecosystem becomes model for evidence-based, transparent, and accountable decentralized governance, attracting more developers, users, and institutional adoption
Broader Web3 industry establishes impact measurement as core practice, leading to more sustainable funding models and increased legitimacy for decentralized organizations

evidenceMetadata.reasoning: Evidence shows that community engagement through conferences and partnerships directly increases active user adoption, as demonstrated by GitHub Sponsors impact on contributor engagement
evidenceMetadata.title: Effect of Pull Request Submission by listing individual OSS contributors on GitHub Sponsors
evidenceMetadata.interventionText: Listing individual OSS contributors on GitHub Sponsors

evidenceMetadata.reasoning: Community outreach and documentation efforts correlate with increased platform adoption, similar to how open-source project visibility drives contributor growth
evidenceMetadata.title: Impact of community engagement on OSS adoption

evidenceMetadata.reasoning: Strong evidence that community engagement activities (conferences, partnerships) directly lead to increased GitHub metrics including stars and contributors, as shown by ecosystem growth patterns
evidenceMetadata.title: Community engagement impact on GitHub ecosystem metrics

evidenceMetadata.reasoning: Preliminary evidence suggests active users improve governance efficiency, though more rigorous studies needed to confirm 40% reduction claim
evidenceMetadata.title: User adoption impact on DAO governance cycles (preliminary)
evidenceMetadata.outcomeText: Reduction in governance proposal revision cycles

evidenceMetadata.reasoning: Well-documented evidence that availability of structured evaluation tools leads to institutional adoption by grant programs, with clear patterns of evidence-based decision-making improvements
evidenceMetadata.title: Structured tools drive grant program adoption and evidence-based funding
evidenceMetadata.interventionText: Logic models created for grant evaluation

evidenceMetadata.reasoning: Rigorous RCT evidence demonstrates that evidence-based grant evaluation frameworks significantly improve capital allocation efficiency, with measured improvements in funding effectiveness across multiple blockchain ecosystems
evidenceMetadata.title: RCT: Evidence-based frameworks improve grant allocation efficiency

evidenceMetadata.reasoning: Meta-analysis of public goods funding shows structured evaluation methods lead to better resource allocation and measurable impact tracking
evidenceMetadata.title: Meta-analysis: Structured evaluation in public goods funding
evidenceMetadata.outcomeText: Better capital allocation and impact tracking

activities-1762933553904-0.name: Feature releases
activities-1762933553904-0.description: Number of major features and updates shipped
activities-1762933553904-0.measurementMethod: GitHub release tracking and changelog documentation

activities-1762933553904-0.name: Code quality metrics
activities-1762933553904-0.description: Test coverage percentage, bug resolution time, and code review completion rate
activities-1762933553904-0.measurementMethod: Automated CI/CD metrics and GitHub analytics

activities-1762933553904-1.name: Community engagement events
activities-1762933553904-1.description: Number of presentations, workshops, and partnership meetings conducted
activities-1762933553904-1.measurementMethod: Event calendar tracking and attendance records

activities-1762933553904-1.name: Documentation completeness
activities-1762933553904-1.description: Percentage of features with comprehensive guides and examples

activities-1762933553904-2.name: Template library size
activities-1762933553904-2.description: Number of ready-to-use logic model templates for common Ethereum use cases

activities-1762933553904-2.name: Case study publications
activities-1762933553904-2.description: Number of detailed case studies showing MUSE application in real Ethereum projects
activities-1762933553904-2.measurementMethod: Published case study count with community validation

output-1762933553904-0.name: Monthly active users
output-1762933553904-0.description: Number of unique users creating or editing logic models per month

output-1762933553904-0.name: User role distribution
output-1762933553904-0.description: Breakdown of users by role (DAO governance, grant programs, developers, researchers)
output-1762933553904-0.measurementMethod: User profile surveys and usage pattern analysis

output-1762933553904-1.name: Logic models created
output-1762933553904-1.description: Total number of logic models built using MUSE platform
output-1762933553904-1.measurementMethod: Database query of created models with metadata

output-1762933553904-1.name: Model quality score
output-1762933553904-1.description: Average completeness and evidence-backing of created models
output-1762933553904-1.measurementMethod: Automated scoring based on metrics, connections, and evidence citations

output-1762933553904-2.name: GitHub engagement
output-1762933553904-2.description: Stars, forks, contributors, and pull requests on MUSE repository

output-1762933553904-2.name: Integration partnerships
output-1762933553904-2.description: Number of active integrations with Ethereum ecosystem tools and platforms
output-1762933553904-2.measurementMethod: Partnership agreements and API usage tracking

outcomes-short-1762933553904-0.name: Grant program adoption rate
outcomes-short-1762933553904-0.description: Percentage of major Ethereum grant programs using MUSE in evaluation process
outcomes-short-1762933553904-0.measurementMethod: Direct surveys and partnership tracking with grant programs

outcomes-short-1762933553904-0.name: Evidence quality improvement
outcomes-short-1762933553904-0.description: Increase in evidence citations and structured reasoning in grant decisions
outcomes-short-1762933553904-0.measurementMethod: Content analysis of grant decision documentation before/after MUSE adoption

outcomes-short-1762933553904-1.name: Proposal efficiency
outcomes-short-1762933553904-1.description: Average number of revision rounds for governance proposals using MUSE vs. baseline
outcomes-short-1762933553904-1.measurementMethod: DAO governance platform data analysis (Snapshot, Tally)

outcomes-short-1762933553904-1.name: Stakeholder satisfaction
outcomes-short-1762933553904-1.description: DAO member satisfaction scores with proposal clarity and decision quality

outcomes-medium-1762933553904-0.name: Public impact reporting
outcomes-medium-1762933553904-0.description: Number of Ethereum projects publishing logic models and impact metrics
outcomes-medium-1762933553904-0.measurementMethod: Public repository tracking and ecosystem report aggregation

outcomes-medium-1762933553904-0.name: Data sharing rate
outcomes-medium-1762933553904-0.description: Percentage of MUSE users who make their models public vs. private

outcomes-medium-1762933553904-1.name: Capital influenced
outcomes-medium-1762933553904-1.description: Total USD value of grants and funding decisions made using MUSE-based evaluation
outcomes-medium-1762933553904-1.measurementMethod: Grant program reporting and DAO treasury transaction tracking

outcomes-medium-1762933553904-1.name: Retrospective completion rate
outcomes-medium-1762933553904-1.description: Percentage of funded projects that complete impact retrospectives using MUSE
outcomes-medium-1762933553904-1.measurementMethod: Follow-up surveys and platform usage tracking

outcomes-medium-1762933553904-2.name: Platform integration depth
outcomes-medium-1762933553904-2.description: Number of native MUSE integrations in DAO and grant platforms
outcomes-medium-1762933553904-2.measurementMethod: API usage logs and partnership documentation

outcomes-medium-1762933553904-2.name: Governance mention frequency
outcomes-medium-1762933553904-2.description: References to MUSE in DAO forum discussions and governance proposals
outcomes-medium-1762933553904-2.measurementMethod: Text analysis of Discourse, Commonwealth, and governance forums

outcomes-long-1762933553904-0.name: Funding effectiveness score
outcomes-long-1762933553904-0.description: Composite metric of project success rate, ecosystem impact, and capital efficiency
outcomes-long-1762933553904-0.measurementMethod: Longitudinal study comparing funded project outcomes against stated goals

outcomes-long-1762933553904-0.name: Ecosystem health indicators
outcomes-long-1762933553904-0.description: Developer retention, active project count, and user growth in funded categories
outcomes-long-1762933553904-0.measurementMethod: Electric Capital Developer Report data and ecosystem analytics

outcomes-long-1762933553904-1.name: Cross-chain adoption
outcomes-long-1762933553904-1.description: Number of non-Ethereum blockchain projects and ecosystems using MUSE
outcomes-long-1762933553904-1.measurementMethod: User registration data and ecosystem partnership tracking

outcomes-long-1762933553904-1.name: Standard establishment
outcomes-long-1762933553904-1.description: Citations in ecosystem reports and adoption by cross-chain organizations

impact-1762933553904-0.name: Ecosystem growth rate
impact-1762933553904-0.description: Year-over-year growth in Ethereum developers, active addresses, and TVL compared to baseline
impact-1762933553904-0.measurementMethod: Electric Capital reports, Dune Analytics dashboards, and DeFi Llama data

impact-1762933553904-0.name: Governance reputation score
impact-1762933553904-0.description: External perception of Ethereum governance quality in industry surveys and media analysis
impact-1762933553904-0.measurementMethod: Sentiment analysis of governance coverage and stakeholder surveys

impact-1762933553904-1.name: Industry practice adoption
impact-1762933553904-1.description: Percentage of top 100 crypto projects with public impact frameworks
impact-1762933553904-1.measurementMethod: Industry survey and public documentation review

impact-1762933553904-1.name: Regulatory recognition
impact-1762933553904-1.description: Citations of impact measurement practices in regulatory guidance and policy discussions
impact-1762933553904-1.measurementMethod: Policy document analysis and regulatory engagement tracking
